de.tuberlin.pserver.math.operations

Interface ApplyOnDoubleElements<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Matrix
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMatrix, Dense64Matrix, DistributedMatrix, RemoteMatrixSkeleton, RemoteMatrixStub, Sparse64Matrix

    public interface ApplyOnDoubleElements<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T applyOnElements(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator f)
      Identical to #applyOnElements(DoubleUnaryOperator, T) but automatically creates the resulting B.
      T applyOnElements(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator f, T B)
      Called on A.
      T applyOnElements(T B, java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator f)
      Identical to #applyOnElements(T, DoubleBinaryOperator, T) but automatically creates the resulting C.
      T applyOnElements(T B, java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator f, T C)
      Called on A.

    • Method Detail

      • applyOnElements

        T applyOnElements(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator f)
        Identical to #applyOnElements(DoubleUnaryOperator, T) but automatically creates the resulting B.

      • applyOnElements

        T applyOnElements(java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator f,
                  T B)
        Called on A. Computes B = f(A) element-wise.
        Note: A and B have to be of the same shape
        Parameters:
        f - Unary higher order function f: x -> y
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing B = f(A) element-wise.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If the shapes of B and A are not equal

      • applyOnElements

        T applyOnElements(T B,
                  java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator f)
        Identical to #applyOnElements(T, DoubleBinaryOperator, T) but automatically creates the resulting C.

      • applyOnElements

        T applyOnElements(T B,
                  java.util.function.DoubleBinaryOperator f,
                  T C)
        Called on A. Computes C = f(A, B) element-wise.
        Note: A and B are wlog. of shape n x m and o x p respectively. It has to hold that n <= o and m <= p. Also the shape of A an C have to be the same.
        Parameters:
        B - containing the elements that are used as second arguments in f
        f - Binary higher order function f: x, y -> z
        C - to store the result in
        Returns:
        A after computing C = f(A, B) element-wise.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If the shape of B is smaller than the one of A in any dimension or if the shapes of C and A are not equal
